title: How has COVID-19 affected touring bands? - Quora

response.answer_text: It has made them pivot towards live streaming and writing new material. Touring revenues will not return until 2021 and touring bands need that revenue. Since record companies stopped supporting bands (tour money, recording backing etc) this has seriously hurt revenue streams for bands. Now with Live Nation changing their policies on guarantees, cancellations and putting the impetus of travel, cancellation fees, and revenue splits more favorable to them rather than artists you may see a major change in the touring landscape in the coming year.

I agree with Gary Brunclick. I have a new album to support and no dates on the horizon. My other band released a new album late last year and we should be supporting that one as well. Nothing. It’s killing potential revenues. So we are using the time to write the next two albums to come out of this with guns blazing.
